result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick Lee Morrow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered restitution in the stipulated amounts of $430.00 to North Shore Bank and $3323 to Town Bank.

COUNTS 1 & 2:  Pay all supervision fees.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done so- pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs.
The Court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to each other and any other time being served with credit for 0 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain full time employment.
Participate in vocational and/or educational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

No use of illegal controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with victims Rita M., Taylor P., Tiffany V., or Town Bank located at 140 S. 1st St. Milwaukee or North Shore Bank located at 5101 S. 76th St, Franklin.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in Cognitive Intervention/Thinking program.

Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.
Cooperate with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to each other and any other time being served with credit for 0 days served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick Lee Morrow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (32 pages) commencing JUNE 30, 2015 received and filed.
and Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.

Defendant Frederick Lee Morrow in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Parties select another date via e-mail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Frederick Lee Morrow in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Frederick Lee Morrow in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  State requested a presentence investigation.  Order for Presentence Investigation signed electronically and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 6/18/15 at 10:00 a.m.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Frederick Lee Morrow not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frederick Lee Morrow in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Frederick Lee Morrow in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TOWN BANK, RITA M. AND LAURA S.; NORTH SHORE BANK, TAYLOR P., LYNEEN F., AND TIFFANY V.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Frederick Lee Morrow in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Frederick Lee Morrow in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
